clinical_study.brief_title: Physical Activity Measured Through Accelerometers and Its Association With Endothelial Function in Young Patients With Fontan Physiology

brief_summary.textblock: This study will be a cross sectional assessment of physical activity as measured through accelerometers and its association with endothelial function of children with Fontan circulation who are followed at the University of Alberta - Stollery Children's hospital.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Once consent/assent is obtained, participants will be asked to wear an Actigraph GT3X+ accelerometers for seven consecutive days, during waking hours.

primary_outcome.measure: Endothelial function measured by Digital Thermal Monitoring (DTM) via the automated, operator-independent protocol (VENDYS-6000, Endothelix Inc., Houston, TX)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Once consent/assent is obtained, endothelial function will be measured one time during a routine clinical visit.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Once during routine clinical visit after informed consent/assent.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Physical activity and endothelial function measures
arm_group.description: To measure physical activity, participants will be asked to wear an Actigraph GT3X+ accelerometers for seven consecutive days, during waking hours. A physical activity log will be provided to document the reason and time periods when the accelerometer is removed and will be cross-referenced with the accelerometer data. To measure endothelial function, participants will undergo Digital Thermal Monitoring (DTM) via the automated, operator-independent protocol (VENDYS-6000, Endothelix Inc., Houston, TX). DTM is a non- invasive, operator-independent device that measures thermal recovery of the fingertip after 5 minutes of occlusion with a blood pressure cuff allowing quantification of endothelial reactivity. Participants will complete a vascular health questionnaire to access factors that can affect endothelial function.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Children with Fontan physiology between the ages 24 months to 18 years at the Stollery Children's Hospital
- Informed written consent obtained prior to enrolment
- At least 6 months post Fontan procedure
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient hospitalized in an intensive care unit and unable to mobilize
- Patient unable to ambulate independently
